TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit UsageStatsManager extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: Provides access to device usage history and statistics.

remarks.para: Provides access to device usage history and statistics. Usage data is aggregated into time intervals: days, weeks, months, and years.

When requesting usage data since a particular time, the request might look something like this:
A request for data in the middle of a time interval will include that interval.

NOTE: This API requires the permission android.permission.PACKAGE_USAGE_STATS, which is a system-level permission and will not be granted to third-party apps. However, declaring the permission implies intention to use the API and the user of the device can grant permission through the Settings application.

Docs.param: The inclusive beginning of the range of stats to include in the results.
The exclusive end of the range of stats to include in the results.
Docs.summary: A convenience method that queries for all stats in the given range (using the best interval for that range), merges the resulting data, and keys it by package name.

remarks.para: A convenience method that queries for all stats in the given range (using the best interval for that range), merges the resulting data, and keys it by package name. See .

Docs.summary: Gets the hardware configurations the device was in for the given time range, aggregated by the specified interval.

remarks.para: Gets the hardware configurations the device was in for the given time range, aggregated by the specified interval. The results are ordered as in .

MemberSignature.Value: public Android.App.Usage.UsageEvents QueryEvents (long beginTime, long endTime);
.method public hidebysig instance class Android.App.Usage.UsageEvents QueryEvents(int64 beginTime, int64 endTime) cil managed

Docs.param: The inclusive beginning of the range of events to include in the results.
The exclusive end of the range of events to include in the results.
Docs.summary: Query for events in the given time range.

remarks.para: Query for events in the given time range. Events are only kept by the system for a few days.
NOTE: The last few minutes of the event log will be truncated to prevent abuse by applications.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Collections.Generic.IList<Android.App.Usage.UsageStats> QueryUsageStats (Android.App.Usage.UsageStatsInterval intervalType, long beginTime, long endTime);

Docs.param: The time interval by which the stats are aggregated.
The inclusive beginning of the range of stats to include in the results.
The exclusive end of the range of stats to include in the results.
Docs.summary: Gets application usage stats for the given time range, aggregated by the specified interval.

remarks.para: Gets application usage stats for the given time range, aggregated by the specified interval.
The returned list will contain a object for each package that has data for an interval that is a subset of the time range given. To illustrate:

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
